content: leave long end copyright croriginals 2017 all rights reserved 4 ears make two round 1 4 single_crochet in ring - you will now work in row back and forth -turn no turning chain row 2 increase across 8 - turn no turning chain row 3 single_crochet 2 half_double_crochet 2 half_double_crochet in next st 2 half_double_crochet in next st half_double_crochet single_crochet 2 10 - leave long end mane attach yarn in first bl of round 10 inserting hook pointing towards back - continue with * single_crochet half_double_crochet double_crochet in first st double_crochet half_double_crochet single_crochet in next st slip_stitch in next st - repeat from * - you will continue this way in all bls of rnds 10 and 11 - fo copyright croriginals 2017 all rights reserved 5 suggested assembly 1 attach eyes between rnds 4 and 5 with 5 stitches between them hold lion so that the beginning and final stitch of the mane are at the bottom 2 stuff head/body weave yarn through last round and tighten - weave in end 3 weave in yarn ends from mane 4 sew legs to body place front legs right after mane and back legs approx 5 rnds from back 5 sew ears to head between the two rnds of mane 6 sew tail to body after round 3 from back nose using approx 18 of dark brown yarn and a tapestry needle - weave yarn from side to side after round 3 until desired fullness bring one strand down from under nose to round 4 for mouth tail tufts use same color yarn as mane cut three 6 strands of yarn and fold in half insert crochet hook in bottom stitch of tail and pull up the three strands at the fold - remove hook and thread ends of strands through the loop and pull tight using a needle pull strands apart to add fullness i love ribbon and have to add one to every cutie i make but that s totally up to you please feel free to contact me with any questions at croriginals58@gmail com copyright croriginals 2017 all rights reserved 6
